tagline: This is a simple jQuery plugin which iconify the html elements based on the file extensions in their attributes.
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
body:
### Usage
Include the iconify.jquery.js file

```javascript
<script src="js/iconify.jquery.js"></script>
```

Then initiate the plugin in your document

```javascript
<script>
$(document).ready(function(){
	$("a").iconify();
});
</script>
```

### Options
You can set the following options:


* `atr`  _Optional_ **`href`** by default : Tell it which attribute of the element to look for.

* `dir`  _Optional_ **`css/iconify-assets/`** by default : Path to the additional file of iconify

* `theme`  _Optional_ **`default`** by default : Which theme to be used for icons

Hope for more options in next versions.

### Examples usage

To look for `data-url` attribute in `<span>` tags:

```javascript
$("span").iconify({ atr : "data-url" });
````

If you want to use your own theme:

```javascript
$("span").iconify({ atr : "data-url", theme : "myCustomTheme" });
````
name: Iconify
